data.title: Paul McCartney’s Children (All about his 5 children)
data.meta_description: Paul McCartney has five children: Heather, Mary, Stella, James, and Beatrice. Here's everything to know about Paul McCartney's children.
data.text:
Paul McCartney is best known for being a member of The Beatles, but to his five kids — Heather, Mary, Stella, James, and Beatrice, he is just dad.

Paul McCartney, born on June 18, 1942, in Liverpool, England, is one of the most influential figures in music history. As a founding member of The Beatles, McCartney played a significant role in shaping the sound of the 1960s and beyond. His contributions to music have left a lasting impact.

The “Let It Be” singer first became a father in 1969 when he married photographer Linda Eastman and adopted her daughter from a previous marriage, Heather, who is now 61. The couple had three more kids together: Mary, who is 54, Stella, who is 52, and James, who is 46.

Linda Eastman died of breast cancer on April 17, 1998. Paul McCartney was very sad about her death and later said he “cried for a year.” In 2002, he married Heather Mills, and they had his youngest child, Beatrice, in October 2003. Beatrice is now 20. However, Paul and Heather separated when Beatrice was just 3 years old.

Paul McCartney married his current wife, Nancy Shevell, in 2011. Now, all his children are grown up. In February 2023, he talked about how his relationship with his kids has changed over the years.

Here is everything to know about Paul McCartney’s five children.

Who are Paul McCartney’s Children?

Paul McCartney has five children: Heather, Mary, Stella, James, and Beatrice. Paul continues to have a close relationship with his children, often reflecting on how his role as a father has evolved over the years.

Get to know about Paul McCartney’s children: Heather, Mary, Stella, James, and Beatrice.

Heather Louise McCartney, 61

Heather Louise McCartney, born on December 31, 1962, is an American-British potter and artist. She is the biological daughter of Linda Eastman and Joseph Melville See Jr., and was adopted by Paul McCartney when he married Linda in 1969. Heather has developed a career in pottery and art, with her work featured in exhibitions around the world, including locations such as New York, Phoenix, Tokyo, Paris, and Sydney.

Heather has maintained a relatively low profile compared to her siblings. She launched her own line of houseware products in 1999 called the Heather McCartney Houseware Collection, inspired by the art of ancient Mexican civilizations. Heather’s artistic journey began early, influenced by her mother, and she won the Young Black and White Printer of the Year Award for a photo she called “Waterfall”​.

Living mostly out of the public eye, Heather resides on her father’s estate in East Sussex. She has never been married and does not have any children. Her life reflects a blend of artistic passion and a preference for privacy.

Mary Anna McCartney, 54

Mary Anna McCartney, born on August 28, 1969, is a renowned photographer, filmmaker, and cookbook author. She is the first child of Paul McCartney and Linda McCartney. Mary followed in her mother’s footsteps, pursuing a career in photography. Her work has been featured in notable publications such as GQ, Vogue, and the Sunday Times. She has also directed the documentary “If These Walls Could Sing” about the history of Abbey Road Studios, which premiered in 2022​.

Mary is an advocate for plant-based living and co-authored several vegetarian cookbooks, including “Food: Vegetarian Home Cooking” and “Linda McCartney’s Family Kitchen” with her father and sister Stella. She also hosts a cooking show on the Food Network titled “Mary McCartney Serves It Up”​.

In addition to her culinary and photographic pursuits, Mary has been involved in various art exhibitions. In 2023, she opened a photography exhibition as part of Sotheby’s ‘(Women) Artists’ campaign, showcasing her extensive work over the past three decades​.

Mary is married to filmmaker Simon Aboud, and they have two sons, Sam and Sid. She continues to live a creative and active life, balancing her professional projects with her personal commitments.​

Stella Nina McCartney, 52

Stella McCartney’s career in fashion began at a young age, and she gained significant recognition when she became the creative director of Chloé in 1997. In 2001, she launched her own fashion house under her name in a joint venture with the luxury goods conglomerate Kering. Her brand is renowned for its ethical approach, using no leather or fur and emphasizing sustainable and environmentally friendly materials.

In 2024, Stella continued to innovate with her Fall/Winter and Spring/Summer collections, emphasizing sustainability. Her Fall/Winter 2024 collection highlighted eco-activism, featuring a manifesto on climate action and using 90% sustainable materials​. For Earth Day 2024, she launched the SOS Capsule Collection, which included garments made from regenerative, recycled, and organic fibers, showcasing her commitment to environmental preservation​.

Stella McCartney’s Spring/Summer 2024 collection was presented at Paris Fashion Week in a vibrant street fair setting, celebrating both fashion and sustainability. The collection featured designs inspired by vintage pieces from her parents’ wardrobe and utilized innovative materials like seaweed-based yarn​.

James Louis McCartney, 46

James Louis McCartney, born on September 12, 1977, is a British-American musician and songwriter, the only son of Paul and Linda McCartney. James has contributed to his parents’ solo albums and has released his own music, blending melodic pop with introspective lyrics.

In 2024, James made a notable comeback with the release of his new single “Beautiful” on February 23, ahead of his upcoming EP. This song marks his first new release since 2016, and he collaborated again with producer David Kahne​. Additionally, James teamed up with Sean Ono Lennon, John Lennon’s son, to release a song titled “Primrose Hill”, their first official musical collaboration.

Beatrice Milly McCartney, 20

Beatrice Milly McCartney, born on October 28, 2003, is the youngest daughter of Paul McCartney and Heather Mills. At 20 years old, Beatrice has largely stayed out of the public eye, focusing on her education and personal interests. She is currently studying at the University of Cambridge and aspires to become a marine biologist​.

Despite her famous parentage, Beatrice has expressed little interest in pursuing a career in the spotlight. Instead, she enjoys playing the saxophone and has a passion for poetry, which she likely inherited from her father​​. Her parents have worked hard to ensure she had a normal childhood, away from the pressures of fame​.

In recent news, Beatrice has been embracing her LGBTQ+ identity, a journey she has decided to share publicly, reflecting her commitment to living authentically.

Why is Paul McCartney Famous?

Paul McCartney is famous primarily for his role as a singer, songwriter, and musician, notably as one of the founding members of the legendary rock band The Beatles. Alongside John Lennon, George Harrison, and Ringo Starr, McCartney played a pivotal role in shaping the sound and direction of popular music in the 1960s.

McCartney’s talent as a songwriter is widely recognized, with many of his compositions becoming timeless classics. He’s known for his melodic prowess, catchy hooks, and versatile songwriting abilities. His contributions to The Beatles include iconic songs like “Hey Jude,” “Let It Be,” “Yesterday,” and many others.

After The Beatles disbanded in 1970, McCartney continued his successful music career as a solo artist, forming the band Wings and releasing numerous solo albums.

He has remained a significant figure in the music industry, receiving numerous awards and accolades, including multiple Grammy Awards, and being inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame twice (as a member of The Beatles and as a solo artist). Beyond music, McCartney has also been involved in activism, philanthropy, and business ventures, further solidifying his status as a cultural icon.

Conclusion

Paul McCartney’s children have each found their own way to shine. Heather McCartney is a talented potter and artist, known for her beautiful houseware collections. Mary McCartney is a successful photographer and filmmaker, following in her mother’s footsteps and also promoting vegetarianism. Stella McCartney is a famous fashion designer who focuses on making eco-friendly and animal-free clothing. James McCartney is a musician, creating his own music and sometimes working with other artists. Lastly, Beatrice McCartney is studying at the University of Cambridge, aiming to become a marine biologist, and she has openly embraced her identity.

Paul McCartney’s children reflect his influence and talent in different areas. Whether it’s through art, photography, fashion, music, or environmental work, they each contribute to their fields, carrying forward the McCartney legacy of creativity and excellence.

Paul McCartney’s Children (All about his 5 children) – FAQs

Who are Paul McCartney’s Children?

Paul McCartney has five children: Heather McCartney, an artist and potter; Mary McCartney, a photographer and filmmaker; Stella McCartney, a renowned fashion designer; James McCartney, a musician; and Beatrice McCartney, a student aiming to become a marine biologist.

How many biological children does Paul McCartney have?

Paul McCartney has four biological children: Mary, Stella, James, and Beatrice.

Is Mary McCartney Paul’s biological daughter?

Yes, Mary McCartney is Paul’s biological daughter.

Which of Paul McCartney’s daughters is adopted?

Heather McCartney is Paul’s adopted daughter.

What happened to Paul McCartney’s daughter with Heather Mills?

Beatrice McCartney, the daughter of Paul McCartney and Heather Mills, is currently studying at the University of Cambridge and aims to become a marine biologist.
